rect.title: Terminal Symbol
rect.desc: The terminal symbol indicates a starting or stopping point in the logic. Every flowchart should start and end with one or more terminal symbols.

polygon.title: Input/Output Symbol
polygon.desc: The input/output symbol represents any single process in an algorithm, such as reading input or writing output.

rect.title: Process Symbol
rect.desc: The process symbol symbol represents any single process in an algorithm, such as assigning a value or performing a calculation. The flow of control is sequential.

path.title: Predefined Process Symbol
path.desc: The predefined process symbol symbol represents a module in an algorithm - that is, a predefined process that has its own flowchart.

polygon.title: Decision Symbol
polygon.desc: The decision symbol symbol represents a decision in the logic single involving the comparison of two values. Alternative paths are followed, depending on whether the decision symbol is true or false.

polygon.title: Preparation Symbol
polygon.desc: The preparation symbol symbol represents a step that establishes conditions for later steps, such as a set-up operation.

circle.title: Connection Symbol
circle.desc: The connection symbol symbol represents a jump from one point in the flow process to another, or between a sub-process and the parent process.
